admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF023485-USDOE-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY ACTIVITIES,TF022865-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY POLICY &
            PROJECT DEV.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Provincial Grid Integration
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory. The most
            important lessons drawn from the experience in implementing
            the project are: 1) Borrower's involvement is key for
            an effective collaboration between Borrower and implementing
            agency. The Bank can play an important role to promote this
            collaboration by ensuring Borrower's representation
            during Bank's mission, project visits, and major
            project events. 2) When an ongoing operation is used to
            provide supplemental financing for technical studies
            associated to potential future operations, this supplemental
            financing should be assigned only after ensuring that
            sufficient funds are available for ongoing activities under
            the project. 3) When there is more than one implementing
            agency involved, individual project agreements between each
            implementing agency and the Bank should be provided. This
            will improve efficiency in the management and accounting of
            loan funds and increase accountability from each
            implementing agency.
